Articles.Content:
This has probably been suggested elsewhere, but I couldn't find a thread that mentioned it, so here goes!

Kerbal statistics, such as time on missions, time in orbit, time on X Planet/Moon, etc. Viewable in the Kerbalnaut Complex. Just little things like that to show progress you've made! I understand stuff such as time on planets and time in orbit may be able to distinguish from one another due to the way the game timer currently works, but at least time spent on missions for each Kerbal would be nice
been talked about indirectly but never a main subject, planned feature though. in fact it was stated a sort of autopiloet would be added based on the skill of the piolet.

I wish I knew how many hours i've played since 0.8.

It's got to be at least a thousand, though. How many Jebs have died T__T

If you ket ksp on steam you can see how menny hours you have waisted, and I think it would be cool to see a kerbal in listed to kerbal killed ratio, his could be used in career mode when it is released
We'll probably have statistics like that accessible from the knowledgebase somewhere 'round KSC. Or something. People just like seeing statistics.

Sounds like an awesome idea. Build up your hero astronauts, more motivation to save them from danger, take them on more ambitious missions, and perhaps adding them to your flight crew will give you added budget or something.
Hours flying craft should reduce your stupidity and increase your bravery which in turn should increase the pilots ability to do what you tell them to do.
